author: Angelita Faller
title: New Cohort of UA Little Rock Teaching Residents Join Jacksonville North Pulaski School District - News - UA Little Rock
text:
New Cohort of UA Little Rock Teaching Residents Join Jacksonville North Pulaski School District
After a successful first year of a new teacher residency program, a second cohort of teacher residents from the University of Arkansas at Little Rock have joined [Jacksonville North Pulaski School District](https://www.jnpsd.org/) (JNPSD) to learn how to become day-one ready teachers.
‚ÄúThe residency program has been an invaluable opportunity for professional growth for our educators as well as our teacher interns,‚Äù JNPSD Superintendent Jeremy Owoh said. ‚ÄúIt provides hands-on experience and mentorship that are critical for developing effective pedagogical skills. I highly recommend the residency program to any superintendent or principal looking to enhance their educator‚Äôs professional capacity and increase their educator pipeline to the District, and I am happy to welcome this second cohort of teaching residents to JNPSD.‚Äù
The seven new residents are working in Bayou Meto Elementary, Bobby G. Lester Elementary, and Murrell Taylor Elementary schools for the 2024-25 school year.
The new teacher residents include Fallon Armstrong, mentored by teacher Amanda Lercher; Trula Bell, mentored by teacher Regina Eubanks; Averee Betts, mentored by teacher Wanda Eskridge; Trinity Gilstrap, mentored by teacher Ashley Polen; Maggee Powell, mentored by teacher Kimberly Williams; Layla Schwab, mentored by teacher Sarah Henderson; and Janelle Solis, mentored by teacher Danielle Pelletier. Dr. Terri Guy serves as the UA Little Rock site coordinator for JNPSD.
‚ÄúThe Trojan Teacher Residents in Jacksonville are working in three different schools, providing high impact math tutoring to small groups of students,‚Äù said Dr. Rachel Eells, Windgate Endowed Director of the [School of Education](https://ualr.edu/education/?gad_source=1&gclid=CjwKCAiA9bq6BhAKEiwAH6bqoPYCWnCZotGjg-3QY_bJIKnRF8drz4XPk6Oq7XBYx7PcdDmxUUoMPhoCGoUQAvD_BwE) at UA Little Rock. ‚ÄúOur partnership with Jacksonville has allowed us to shift to respond to their district‚Äôs needs, and these residents applied for the role, knowing that this was the particular need for this year. We are pleased to be able to partner for experiences that accomplish multiple goals.‚Äù
Last year, the first participants of the teacher residency program worked in Jacksonville at Murrell Taylor Elementary and Jacksonville Middle School. In lieu of traditional student teaching, residents spent the entire academic year in the same classroom with an experienced teacher mentor, learning all the tricks of the trade to be successful educators.
‚ÄúEver since I was a little girl, I loved and enjoyed being around kids. I enjoyed it so much I would set up my room as a ‚Äòclassroom‚Äô and play teacher with my family and friends,‚Äù said Averee Betts, a senior elementary education major from Benton who is teaching fourth-grade math. ‚ÄúI am very thankful for this opportunity and to be a part of the Jacksonville School District. This residency also is very hands-on and helps prepare me by having the opportunity to teach and be the teacher of the classroom.‚Äù
The teacher residency program is supported by a grant from [Forward Arkansas](https://forwardarkansas.org/), which is helping UA Little Rock address Arkansas‚Äôs teacher shortage by working to increase the number and diversity of teacher candidates entering the field.
Maggee Powell, a senior elementary education major from Benton, originally planned to go into healthcare, but quickly realized that it wasn‚Äôt for her.
‚ÄúI had a realization that my true passion is with kids, that being in a classroom is where I saw myself,‚Äù Powell said, adding that participating in the residency program has allowed her to grow as a teacher.
‚ÄúBeing in an internship with a support system is truly so important,‚Äù Powell said. ‚ÄúI feel supported by my colleagues and my fellow classmates. Murrell Taylor has shown me a true support system, and I am forever thankful. I have grown to love Murrell Taylor and the people at it. They have welcomed me like I was already family.‚Äù
Trinity Gilstrap, a senior middle childhood education major concentrating in science from Cabot, is teaching fifth-grade science and writing at Bayou Meto Elementary. She credits her fourth-grade teacher Mr. West for inspiring her to become a teacher, but thanks her teacher mentor Ashley Polen for showing her how to be a good teacher.
‚ÄúBeing a part of this teacher residency program is helping me prepare to be a day-one ready teacher because I‚Äôm gaining confidence in teaching,‚Äù Gilstrap said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm seeing all aspects of what a teacher really does and how to handle a classroom. So, when it comes time for me to teach, I‚Äôll know what to do and how to do things!‚Äù

title: Muere presunto extorsionador tras intentar lanzar bomba a negocio; le explot√≥ en la mano (VIDEO)
text: Muere presunto extorsionador tras intentar lanzar bomba a negocio; le explot√≥ en la mano (VIDEO)Los hechos se registraron alrededor de las 22:00 horas la noche del mi√©rcoles pasado en Ecuador [Janet G√≥mez](https://www.reporteindigo.com/author/janet-gomez/) La noche del 27 de diciembre pasado, un individuo, presuntamente implicado en actividades de extorsi√≥n, perdi√≥ la vida al intentar arrojar una bomba dentro de un negocio; sin embargo, el explosivo estall√≥ en sus manos. Usuarios en redes sociales atribuyeron la tragedia al ‚Äúkarma‚Äù. El tr√°gico incidente tuvo lugar en la ciudad de Guayaquil, [Ecuador](https://www.reporteindigo.com/latitud/mexico-y-ecuador-podrian-tensar-sus-relaciones-por-proteccion-de-jorge-glas-espinel/), alrededor de las 22:00 del mi√©rcoles pasado, cuando el sujeto y un c√≥mplice llegaron al lugar con la intenci√≥n de causar da√±o al establecimiento. Seg√∫n los informes preliminares, el individuo trat√≥ de intimidar a los propietarios de un local comercial, pero las cosas salieron mal. El impactante video, captado por una c√°mara de seguridad, se volvi√≥ viral en redes sociales, generando comentarios de ‚Äúalegr√≠a‚Äù por la muerte de lo que muchos consideraron una ‚Äúlacra para la sociedad‚Äù. [#URGENTE]Guayaquil sangre" Y Miseria, Plan F√©nix un Fracaso C√°maras captaron el momento en el que un vacunador intentaba colocar una bomba en un local comercial y esta explot√≥ dej√°ndolo sin vida. El sonido de la explosi√≥n se escuch√≥ en gran parte del norte de la ciudad. [pic.twitter.com/xCW245GbdD] ‚Äî Unidad Nacional de las Organizaciones GUAYAS (@UnidadN593) [December 28, 2023] Intent√≥ lanzar el explosivo En las im√°genes, se observa al individuo bajando de un autom√≥vil de color naranja y sacando un artefacto antes de dirigirse hacia el establecimiento. Sin embargo, el artefacto no explot√≥. Despu√©s de unos segundos, el sujeto intent√≥ manipularlo, pero en cuesti√≥n de segundos, se produjo la explosi√≥n que se escuch√≥ en toda la regi√≥n norte de la ciudad y le caus√≥ la muerte instant√°nea. [#Guayaquil] Se difunde video donde vacunador intentaba colocar una bomba en alguna vivienda o local comercial y EXPLOTA dej√°ndolo sin vida. Por la Av. Francisco de Orellana, a pocos metros del Riocentro. El sonido de la explosi√≥n se escuch√≥ en gran parte del norte de la ciudad. [pic.twitter.com/fxHwfGitWk] ‚Äî ùïΩùñÜùñöùñë ùï∞ùñòùñïùñéùñìùñäùñë (@RaulEspinelDED) [December 28, 2023] Su cuerpo fue abandonado La cortina de humo resultante fue aprovechada por el conductor del autom√≥vil para escapar. El cuerpo del presunto extorsionador qued√≥ abandonado en el lugar, donde los servicios de emergencia confirmaron su fallecimiento. Hasta el momento, la persona que lo acompa√±aba no ha sido detenida. [La Unidad Nacional de las Organizaciones GUAYAS](https://twitter.com/UnidadN593), un organismo que agrupa a ONG ecuatorianas, se√±al√≥ que el aumento de este tipo de delitos en Ecuador se debe a la falla de la estrategia de seguridad. ‚Äú#URGENTE Guayaquil sangre y Miseria, Plan F√©nix un Fracaso. C√°maras captaron el momento en el que un vacunador intentaba colocar una bomba en un local comercial y esta explot√≥, dej√°ndolo sin vida. El sonido de la explosi√≥n se escuch√≥ en gran parte del norte de la ciudad‚Äù, puntualiz√≥ el organismo en su cuenta de X.
